Delaunay tetrahedralization


Functions

GtvCell * gtv_delaunay_check (GtvVolume *v)

Function Documentation

gint gtv_delaunay_add_vertex ( GtvVolume *  v,
GtsVertex *  p,
GtvCell *  c 
)

Add a GtsVertex to a GtvVolume, preserving the Delaunay property.

Parameters:
v a GtvVolume;
p a GtsVertex to be added to v;
c a GtvCell which is an initial guess for the location of p, or NULL.
Returns:
GTV_SUCCESS on insertion of p in v, or an appropriate error code.

gint gtv_delaunay_add_vertex_to_cell ( GtvVolume *  v,
GtsVertex *  p,
GtvCell *  c 
)

Add a GtsVertex to a GtvCell of a GtvVolume, restoring the Delaunay property of the volume, using the method of Edelsbrunner, H. and Shah, N. R., Algorithmica 15:223--241, 1996 and Lawson, C., Computer Aided Geometric Design, 3:231--246, 1986, as described in Ledoux, H., `Computing the 3D Voronoi diagram robustly: An easy explanation', 4th International Symposium on Voronoi Diagrams in Science and Engineering, 2007.

Parameters:
v a GtvVolume;
p a GtsVertex to add to p;
c a GtvCell to add p to.
Returns:
GTV_SUCCESS on success, non-zero if p is already part of c or coincides with a vertex of c.

GtvCell* gtv_delaunay_check ( GtvVolume *  v  ) 

Check whether a GtvVolume satisfies the Delaunay property.

Parameters:
v volume to check
Returns:
a non-Delaunay GtvCell of v if v is non-Delaunay, NULL otherwise.

gboolean gtv_facet_is_regular ( GtvFacet *  f  ) 

Check if a GtvFacet is regular. A facet is regular if neither of the tetrahedra using it has the apex of the opposite tetrahedron inside its circumsphere. Boundary facets and isolated facets are also considered regular.

Parameters:
f a GtvFacet.
Returns:
TRUE if f is regular, FALSE otherwise.
